text: hello I'm aniket from the AWS glue team
and today I want to introduce a feature
launched by AWS glue jobs called AWS
glue Flex
so what are dreamfax jobs
Flex is a new execution class option for
AWS glue jobs these jobs utilize spare
capacity at a much lower cost instead of
dedicated Hardware despite this Flex
jobs provide all the same capabilities
as a standard glue job including Auto
scaling access to custom connectors
visual job authoring and the rest
so how do I utilize this Flex capacity
from the studio console quickly studio
console I head over to the job details
tab scroll down and check the box for
Flex execution
I also set an appropriate value for the
job timer
and hit run
once I hit run I can go to the runs Tab
and check the execution class the sector
Flex for my particular Java
and if I were to use the CLI I can
simply set the execution class parameter
to flex
so what scenarios would I typically use
flex capacity drops in
any workloads that are time insensitive
that is they do not have strict start or
stop time requirements are ideal for
switching to flex jobs that run one-time
bulk injection type workloads are one
such examples second any jobs running in
testing or pre-production environments
are easy to switch to flex and save on
costs and finally running nightly EPL
jobs that do not depend on any other
upstream or Downstream processes can
benefit from using Flex capacity
for more information on facts check out
the links below
thanks so much for listening
